00010 void help_command_line(char *my_name){
00011   fprintf (stderr,"\nusage: %s  [flags] \n\n",my_name);
00012   fprintf (stderr,"valid options are:\n");
00013   fprintf (stderr,"  -i <filename>\t\t Input root tree file.\n");
00014   fprintf (stderr,"  -o <filename>\t\t Output root tree file.\n");  
00015   fprintf (stderr,"  -n <count>\t\t Analyze only <count> events.\n");
00016   fprintf (stderr,"     <first> <last>\t Analyze only events from "
00017            "<first> to <last>.\n");
00018   fprintf (stderr,"  -r <PSI run number>\t\t Run number specification for the shrubs.\n");
00019   fprintf (stderr,"  -m <modules file>\t\t Name of the MODULES file to be used.\n");
00020   fprintf (stderr,"\n");
00021   return;
00022 }

00024 bool isNumber(char *c){
00025   for(size_t i=0; i<strlen(c); i++){
00026     if(!isdigit(c[i])) return false;
00027   }
00028   return true;
00029 }
00030 
00031 int GetRunNumber(char* input_file){
00032         std::string run_number=input_file;
00033         //remove the extension
00034         run_number=run_number.substr(0,run_number.find_last_of('.'));
00035         //find the last numbers
00036         run_number=run_number.substr(run_number.find_last_not_of("01234566789")+1);
00037         return atoi(run_number.c_str());
00038 }

00040 static char correction_file[300];
00041 static char mod_file[300];
00042 int check_arguments(ARGUMENTS& arguments){
00043   if(arguments.stop >0){
00044     if(arguments.stop <= arguments.start){
00045       printf("ERROR: Cannot process events from %d to %d because %d<=%d\n",
00046              arguments.start, arguments.stop, arguments.stop, arguments.start);
00047       return 1;
00048     }
00049   }
00050 
00051   if(strcmp(arguments.infile,"")==0){
00052     printf("ERROR: Empty input file name. Did you specify the -i option?\n");
00053     return 2;
00054   }  
00055   if(strcmp(arguments.outfile,"")==0){
00056     printf("ERROR: Empty output file name. Did you specify the -o option?\n");
00057     return 3;
00058   }  
00059   if(arguments.run==-1){
00060     // No run number has been set, obtain it from the filename
00061     arguments.run=GetRunNumber(arguments.infile);
00062   }
00063   if(strcmp(arguments.mod_file,"")==0){
00064     sprintf(mod_file,"MODULES");
00065     arguments.mod_file=mod_file;
00066   }
00067   if(strcmp(arguments.correction_file,"")==0){
00068     sprintf(correction_file,"wiremap_corrections/correct%d.dat",arguments.run);
00069     arguments.correction_file=correction_file;
00070   }
00071   return 0; //success
00072 }

00074 void PrintLocation(){
00075     static int count=0;
00076     printf("At location %d\n",count++);
00077 }

00079 int analyze_command_line (int argc, char **argv, ARGUMENTS& arguments){
00080   // Inialise the arguments to be consistently meaningless
00081   arguments.infile="";
00082   arguments.outfile="";
00083   arguments.correction_file="";
00084   arguments.start=0;
00085   arguments.stop=0;
00086   arguments.run=-1;
00087 
00088   // Now loop over all the arguments 
00089   if(argc==1) {
00090       help_command_line(argv[0]);
00091       return 1;
00092   }
00093   if(strcmp(argv[1],"--help")==0){
00094       help_command_line(argv[0]);
00095       return 1;
00096   }
00097 
00098   for(int i=1; i<argc; /* incrementing of i done in the loop! */){
00099     if(argv[i][0] != '-'){
00100       printf("ERROR: Wrong argument %s\n",argv[i]);
00101       help_command_line(argv[0]); return 1;
00102     }
00103 
00104    if(strlen(&argv[i][1]) != 1){ 
00105      printf("ERROR: All options must be single characters, "
00106         "separated with a space and prefixed with a '-'\n");
00107       help_command_line(argv[0]); return 1;
00108    }
00109    switch(argv[i][1]){
00110    case 'm':
00111      if(i+1 < argc){
00112        arguments.mod_file = argv[i+1];
00113        i+=2;
00114      }
00115      else{
00116        printf("ERROR: No argument for module file specified\n");
00117        help_command_line(argv[0]); return 1;
00118      }
00119      break;
00120    case 'i':
00121      if(i+1 < argc){
00122        arguments.infile = argv[i+1];
00123        i+=2;
00124      }
00125      else{
00126        printf("ERROR: No argument for input file specified\n");
00127        help_command_line(argv[0]); return 1;
00128      }
00129      break;
00130    case 'o':
00131      if(i+1 < argc){
00132        arguments.outfile = argv[i+1];
00133        i+=2;
00134      }
00135      else{
00136        printf("ERROR: No argument for input file specified\n");
00137        help_command_line(argv[0]); return 1;
00138      }
00139      break;
00140         case 's':
00141      if(i+1 < argc){
00142        arguments.correction_file = argv[i+1];
00143        i+=2;
00144      }
00145      else{
00146        printf("ERROR: No argument for TSetupData correction file specified\n");
00147        help_command_line(argv[0]); return 1;
00148      }
00149      break;
00150    case 'n':
00151      if(i+1 < argc){
00152        if(isNumber(argv[i+1])){
00153          arguments.start = atoi(argv[i+1]);
00154          i+=2;
00155        }
00156        else{
00157          printf("ERROR: Argument %s for option -n is not a number\n",argv[i+1]);
00158          help_command_line(argv[0]); return 1;
00159        }
00160        if(i < argc && argv[i][0]!='-'){
00161          if(isNumber(argv[i])){
00162       arguments.stop = atoi(argv[i]);
00163       i+=1;
00164          }
00165          else{
00166       printf("ERROR: Argument %s for option -n is not a number\n", argv[i]);
00167       help_command_line(argv[0]); return 1;
00168          }
00169        }
00170      }
00171      else{
00172        printf("ERROR: No argument for number of processed events specified\n");
00173        help_command_line(argv[0]); return 1;
00174      }
00175      break;
00176    case 'r':
00177      if(i+1 < argc){
00178        if(isNumber(argv[i+1])){
00179          arguments.run = atoi(argv[i+1]);
00180          i+=2;
00181        }
00182        else{
00183          printf("ERROR: Argument %s for option -r is not a number\n",argv[i+1]);
00184          help_command_line(argv[0]); return 1;
00185        }
00186      }
00187      break;
00188    default:
00189      printf("ERROR: Argument %s not recognized\n",argv[i]);
00190      help_command_line(argv[0]); return 1;
00191    } // End switch block
00192   } // End for loop over all args
00193 
00194   // Everything looks ok, so we now check the arguments
00195   int ret = check_arguments( arguments);
00196   return ret; 
00197 
00198 }

00200 int load_config_file(const char* filename){
00201     modules::reader modules_file;
00202     modules_file.ReadFile(filename);
00203     modules_file.PrintAllOptions();
00204 
00205     modules::factory* mgr = modules::factory::Instance();
00206     size_t num_modules=modules_file.GetNumModules();
00207     std::cout<<"number of modules requested: "<<num_modules<<std::endl;
00208     std::string name;
00209     modules::options* opts;
00210     modules::BaseModule *mods[num_modules];
00211     for(unsigned i=0;i<num_modules;i++){
00212             name = modules_file.GetModule(i);
00213             opts =  modules_file.GetOptions(i);
00214             std::cout<<"Creating module: "<<name<<std::endl;
00215             std::cout<<"With options:"<<std::endl;
00216             opts->DumpOptions("  ");
00217             mods[i] = mgr->createModule(name,opts);
00218     }
00219 
00220     return 0;
00221 }
